english_translation: A person heard from Ubayy, Zayd, and Aisha, and Abu Bakr ibn Hazm narrated from him.

narrators.name: Abu Bakr ibn Hazm
narrators.full_name: Abu Bakr Muhammad ibn Hazm ibn Abi al-Khayr

narrators.name: Ubayy
narrators.alternative_names: Father of the Qur'an, Abu al-Mundhir

chainIssues: Incomplete chain - intermediate narrators not specified between the source and Abu Bakr ibn Hazm
Fragmentary nature of the transmission information in the source

potential_issues.impact: The source does not provide clear chain of transmission; only mentions that someone heard from Ubayy, Zayd, and Aisha, with Abu Bakr ibn Hazm narrating from this unspecified person. This lack of clarity about the intermediate narrators creates ambiguity in the chain.

potential_issues.issue: Unknown narrator at the beginning of chain
potential_issues.impact: The primary narrator (the one who heard from the three companions) is not identified in the text, making full evaluation of the chain impossible.

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok

english_translation: Information about Harmalah ibn Imran Abu Hafs al-Tajibi al-Misri.

potential_issues.issue: No hadith text or chain provided
potential_issues.impact: This entry contains only a narrator's biographical information without any actual hadith transmission. Cannot be analyzed as a complete hadith.

english_translation: Aqabah ibn Muslim and Abu al-Aswad Muhammad were heard from; Ibn al-Mubarak, Abu Abd al-Rahman al-Muqri, and Abdullah ibn Salih heard from him.

narrators.name: Ibn al-Mubarak
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn al-Mubarak ibn Wadih al-Hanzi
narrators.alternative_names: Abdullah ibn al-Mubarak, Abu Abd al-Rahman

narrators.name: Aqabah ibn Muslim
reliabilityIssues: Mixed reliability reports from different scholars

chainIssues: Incomplete transmission chain - intermediate narrators between Ibn al-Mubarak and Aqabah ibn Muslim not specified
Multiple narrators mentioned who heard from the same source, but their relationship to each other unclear
Fragmentary presentation of transmission information makes full chain reconstruction difficult

potential_issues.issue: Incomplete chain structure with unspecified intermediate narrators
potential_issues.impact: The source mentions multiple narrators (Ibn al-Mubarak, Abu Abd al-Rahman al-Muqri, Abdullah ibn Salih) who heard from Aqabah and another person, but does not clearly establish the complete chain of transmission.
The source appears to be a biographical dictionary or narrator register that lists transmission relationships without providing complete hadith chains, limiting analysis.

potential_issues.issue: Aqabah ibn Muslim's reliability varies in scholarly assessment
potential_issues.impact: While generally accepted as Saduq (acceptable), some scholars have reservations about his accuracy in transmission.

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok

english_translation: Information about Harmalah ibn Abd al-Aziz ibn al-Rabi ibn Sabrah ibn Mu'abbad al-Juhani Abu Sa'id.

potential_issues.issue: No hadith text or transmission chain provided
potential_issues.impact: This entry contains only a narrator's full genealogical name without any actual hadith content. Cannot be analyzed as a complete hadith record.

english_translation: He heard from his father and from his uncle Abd al-Malik. Al-Humaydi heard from him. Ibn Hajar said: I saw him at Dhu al-Marwah at the wadi al-Qura.

narrators.name: Al-Humaydi
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn az-Zubayr ibn al-Awwam al-Humaydi

narrators.name: Abd al-Malik
reliabilityIssues: Not mentioned in major hadith sources

chainIssues: Father not named - only referred to as father
Incomplete genealogy of the primary narrator
Use of عَنْ (from) for Abd al-Malik creates ambiguity about direct hearing

potential_issues.impact: The entry does not clearly name the person who heard from his father and uncle, making it impossible to evaluate their reliability or establish their position in the transmission chain.

potential_issues.issue: Abd al-Malik is an unknown narrator (Majhul)
potential_issues.impact: No information about Abd al-Malik's reliability, trustworthiness, or scholarly standing is available. This significantly weakens the chain as one link is completely unknown.

potential_issues.issue: Use of عَنْ with unknown narrator
potential_issues.impact: The transmission from the unnamed father is reported using عَنْ (from), which could indicate indirect transmission or contemporaneity without confirmed direct hearing.

potential_issues.issue: Ibn Hajar's observation is biographical, not authenticating
potential_issues.impact: Ibn Hajar's note that he saw the person at a particular location is descriptive/biographical and does not serve as authentication of any hadith transmission.

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok

english_translation: Information about Harmalah ibn Yahya ibn Abdullah ibn Harmalah ibn Imran al-Tajibi al-Misri.

potential_issues.issue: No hadith text or transmission chain
potential_issues.impact: This entry contains only a narrator's full genealogical listing without any hadith content. This appears to be a biographical dictionary entry rather than a hadith record.
